ga: Déantar an víreas a tharchur go príomha trí bhraoiníní riospráide agus aerasóil le linn sraothartaí, casachtaí, nó in idirghníomhú le daoine eile atá an-ghar (níos lú ná dhá mhéadar de ghnáth).

en: The virus can survive on different surfaces for several hours (on copper or cardboard) or up to a few days (on plastic or stainless steel).
ga: Is féidir leis an víreas maireachtáil ar dhromchlaí éagsúla go ceann roinnt uaireanta an chloig (ar chopar nó ar chairtchlár) nó suas le roinnt laethanta (ar phlaisteach nó ar chruach dhosmálta).

en: The average incubation period for COVID-19
ga: Maidir leis an meántréimhse ghoir do COVID-19

en: Who is at risk of COVID-19?
ga: Cé atá i mbaol ó COVID-19?

en: Everyone is at risk of getting COVID-19, with some population groups having a higher risk of developing severe disease.
ga: Tá gach duine i mbaol ó COVID-19 a tholgadh, agus tá riosca níos airde ag roinnt grúpaí den daonra galar trom a tholgadh.

en: Crowded indoor environments provide opportunities for COVID-19 outbreaks, with prisons, migrant centres and food processing plants being examples of places where outbreaks have been reported.
ga: Cuireann timpeallachtaí plódaithe taobh istigh deiseanna ar fáil maidir le ráigeanna COVID-19, agus is samplaí iad d’áiteanna inar tuairiscíodh ráigeanna ná príosúin, ionaid imirceacha agus gléasraí próiseála bia.

en: Those groups at increased risk of developing severe COVID-19 disease are:
ga: Is iad a leanas na grúpaí sin atá i mbaol galar dian COVID-19 a tholgadh:

en: people aged 60 years and above;
ga: daoine 60 bliain d’aois agus níos sine;

en: people with underlying health conditions, such as obesity, hypertension, diabetes, cardiovascular disease, chronic respiratory disease, or weakened immune systems.
ga: daoine a bhfuil bunfhadhbanna sláinte acu, amhail otracht, hipirtheannas, diaibéiteas, galar cardashoithíoch, galar riospráide ainsealach, nó córais imdhíonachta lagaithe.

en: How can COVID-19 be prevented?
ga: Conas COVID-19 a chosc?

en: Vaccines to prevent COVID-19 first became available in the EU/EEA in late December 2020.
ga: Cuireadh vacsaíní chun COVID-19 a chosc ar fáil den chéad uair san AE/LEE go déanach i mí na Nollag 2020.

en: It is recommended to keep physical distance (a minimum of one or, ideally, two metres) from others in public places, and to avoid gatherings of large groups of people to reduce the risk of infection through respiratory droplets.
ga: Moltar fad fisiciúil a choinneáil (ar a laghad méadar amháin nó, go hidéalach, dhá mhéadar) ó dhaoine eile in áiteanna poiblí, agus bailiú grúpaí móra daoine a sheachaint chun an baol ionfhabhtaithe trí bhraoiníní riospráide a laghdú.

en: For an overview of actions that people and communities can take to help slow down the spread of COVID-19 see: Infographic: Non-pharmaceutical measures.
ga: Chun forléargas a fháil ar na gníomhaíochtaí is féidir le daoine agus le pobail a dhéanamh chun moill a chur ar scaipeadh COVID-19, féach: Grafaic faisnéise: Bearta neamh-chógaisíochta.

en: The virus enters the body via the eyes, nose or mouth, so it is important to avoid touching the face with unwashed hands.
ga: Téann an víreas isteach sa chorp trí na súile, tríd an tsrón nó tríd an mbéal, mar sin tá sé tábhachtach gan lámh nach bhfuil nite a leagan ar an aghaidh.

en: Scientists and clinicians are studying several treatments for COVID-19.
ga: Tá eolaithe agus cliniceoirí ag déanamh staidéir faoi láthair ar roinnt cóireálacha le haghaidh COVID-19.

en: Healthcare providers mostly treat COVID-19 symptoms rather than targeting the virus itself by offering supportive care
ga: Den chuid is mó, cuireann soláthraithe cúraim sláinte cóir leighis ar shiomptóim COVID-19 seachas díriú ar an víreas féin, trí chúram tacúil

en: For severely and critically ill patients, a number of medicines are being tested to target the virus, but their use still needs to be assessed more thoroughly.
ga: Maidir le hothair atá breoite go dian agus go criticiúil, tá tástáil á déanamh ar roinnt cógas chun díriú ar an víreas, ach ní mór measúnú níos doimhne a dhéanamh ar a n-úsáid.

en: For the latest information on COVID-19 treatments, visit the European Medicines Agency’s (EMA) website: Treatments and vaccines for COVID-19
ga: Chun teacht ar an bhfaisnéis is déanaí maidir le cóireálacha COVID-19, féach láithreán gréasáin na Gníomhaireachta Leigheasra Eorpaí (EMA): Cóireálacha agus vacsaíní COVID-19

en: After your Comirnaty (Pfizer/ BioNTech) COVID-19 vaccine
ga: Tar éis Vacsaín Comirnaty (Pfizer/BioNTech) in aghaidh COVID-19 a fháil

en: Thank you for protecting yourself and others by getting the vaccine.
ga: Go raibh maith agat as an vacsaín a fháil le tú féin agus daoine eile a chosaint.

en: Now that you have had your vaccine, we ask you to read this document carefully, so you know how you can expect to feel in the next few days and where to get more information.
ga: Anois go bhfuil an vacsaín faighte agat, iarraimid ort an doiciméad seo a léamh go cúramach le go mbeidh a fhios agat cén chaoi a mbeidh tú ag aireachtáil as seo go ceann cúpla lá agus cá háit ar féidir leat teacht ar a thuilleadh eolais.

en: Do read the COVID-19 vaccine information leaflet we gave you about the vaccine too.
ga: Iarrtar ort an bhileog eolais a thugamar duit maidir leis an vacsaín in aghaidh COVID-19 a léamh freisin.

en: We are also giving you a record of your vaccination today.
ga: Ar deireadh, táimid le taifead ar do vacsaíniú inniu a thabhairt duit chomh maith.

en: Please keep the record card safe.
ga: Iarrtar ort an cárta taifid vacsaínithe sin a choinneáil in áit shábháilte.

en: What might happen in the next few days?
ga: Céard a d’fhéadfadh tarlú as seo go ceann cúpla lá?

en: Some people who got the vaccine that you got today will:
ga: Cuid de na daoine a fuair an vacsaín chéanna agus a fuair tú inniu:

en: have tenderness and swelling in the arm where they had the vaccine injection
ga: bhí frithireacht agus at orthu sa ghéag láimhe ar ar tugadh an t-instealladh vacsaíne dóibh

en: feel tired
ga: bhí tuirse orthu

en: get a headache
ga: bhí tinneas cinn orthu

en: have muscle pain
ga: bhí pian sna matáin acu

en: have joint pain
ga: bhí pian sna hailt acu

en: have diarrhoea
ga: bhí buinneach orthu

en: get a fever (temperature of 38 degrees Celsius or above).
ga: bhí fiabhras orthu (teocht 38 céim Celsius nó os a chionn).

en: As with all vaccines, you can report suspected side effects to the Health Products Regulatory Authority (HPRA).
ga: Mar is amhlaidh i gcás gach vacsaíne, is féidir leat fo-iarmhairtí amhrasta a thuairisciú don Údarás Rialála Táirgí Sláinte.

en: To report side effects to a COVID-19 vaccine, please visit www.hpra.ie/report
ga: Le fo-iarmhairtí aon cheann de na vacsaíní in aghaidh COVID-19 a thuairisciú, téigh chuig www.hpra.ie/report

en: What if I have a fever or have aches and pains?
ga: Céard ba cheart dom a dhéanamh má bhíonn fiabhras nó tinneas agus pianta orm?

en: If you have a fever or you have aches and pains, you can take paracetamol or ibuprofen to help.
ga: Má bhíonn fiabhras nó tinneas agus pianta ort, is féidir leat paraicéiteamól nó iobúpróifein a thógáil le hiad a mhaolú.

en: However, if your fever lasts more than 48 hours or if you are still concerned, please seek medical advice.
ga: Mar sin féin, faigh comhairle leighis má mhaireann d’fhiabhras níos mó ná 48 uair an chloig nó má bhíonn imní fós ort.

en: Do not take ibuprofen if you are pregnant.
ga: Ná tóg iobúpróifein má tá tú ag iompar clainne.

en: Do I need to do anything before I get the second dose of the vaccine?
ga: An gá dom aon rud a dhéanamh sula bhfaighidh mé an dara dáileog den vacsaín?

en: When you are having your next and final dose of the vaccine, please tell the vaccination team if there have been any changes in your medical history.
ga: Nuair a bheidh an chéad dáileog eile (i.e. an dáileog deiridh) den vacsaín á fáil agat, inis don fhoireann vacsaínithe má tá aon athrú tagtha ar do stair leighis idir an dá linn.

en: Bring your vaccination record card with you when going to get the second dose.
ga: Tabhair leat do chárta taifid vacsaínithe nuair a rachaidh tú leis an dara dáileog a fháil.

en: This will be in 28 days’ time (four weeks).
ga: Is i gceann 28 lá (ceithre seachtaine) a gheobhaidh tú an dara dáileog.

en: The good news
ga: An dea-scéala

en: Getting a COVID-19 vaccine should protect you from the serious complications of COVID-19.
ga: Ba cheart go gcosnódh an vacsaín thú in aghaidh na ndeacrachtaí tromchúiseacha a bhaineann le COVID-19.

en: Vaccines teach your immune system to protect you from diseases.
ga: Múineann vacsaíní do do chóras imdhíonachta cén chaoi tú a chosaint in aghaidh galar.

en: It is much safer for your immune system to learn this through vaccination than by getting COVID-19.
ga: Tá sé i bhfad níos sábháilte do do chóras imdhíonachta an méid sin a fhoghlaim trí vacsaíniú ná trí COVID-19 a tholgadh.

en: We are still learning
ga: Táimid fós ag foghlaim

en: It takes 7 days after getting the second dose for it to work.
ga: Ní thosóidh an vacsaín ag obair go ceann 7 lá tar éis an dara dáileog a fháil.

en: There is a small chance you might still get COVID-19 even if you have the vaccine.
ga: Tá seans beag fós ann go dtolgfaidh tú COVID-19 fiú tar éis an vacsaín a fháil.

en: We do not know yet if having the vaccine stops you spreading the virus to others, so you must continue to follow public health advice:
ga: Ní fios go fóill an féidir le daoine vacsaínithe an víreas a scaipeadh ar dhaoine eile, mar sin ní mór duit leanúint ort ag cloí leis an gcomhairle sláinte poiblí:

en: follow social distancing guidelines (keep two metres apart from others where possible)
ga: cloí leis na treoirlínte maidir le scaradh sóisialta (fan dhá mhéadar amach ó dhaoine eile nuair is féidir)

en: wear a face covering
ga: cumhdach aghaidhe a chur ort

en: wash your hands regularly.
ga: do lámha a ní go rialta.

en: Have a question?
ga: An bhfuil ceist agat?

en: If you are unsure about anything, or have any questions about the COVID-19 vaccine please ask your vaccinator today.
ga: Mura bhfuil tú cinnte faoi rud ar bith, nó má tá aon cheist agat faoin vacsaín in aghaidh COVID-19, cuir ceist ar an duine atá ag tabhairt na vacsaíne duit inniu.

en: After your COVID-19 Vaccine Moderna
ga: Tar éis duit Vacsaín Moderna in aghaidh COVID-19 a fháil

en: have tenderness, swelling, redness and/or itching in the arm where they had the vaccine injection
ga: bhí frithireacht, at, baill dhearga agus/nó tochas orthu sa ghéag láimhe ar ar tugadh an t-instealladh vacsaíne dóibh

en: have swollen lymph glands under the arm where they had the injection
ga: bhí faireoga limfe ata acu faoi bhun na géige láimhe ar ar tugadh an t-instealladh dóibh

en: have nausea or vomiting
ga: bhí samhnas nó urlacan orthu

en: Bring your vaccination record card with you when going to get the second dose
ga: Tabhair leat do chárta taifid vacsaínithe nuair a rachaidh tú leis an dara dáileog a fháil

en: Getting a COVID-19 vaccine should protect you from the serious complications of COVID-19.
ga: Ba cheart go gcosnódh an vacsaín thú in aghaidh na ndeacrachtaí tromchúiseacha a bhaineann le COVID-19.

en: It takes 14 days after getting the second dose for it to work.
ga: Ní thosóidh an vacsaín ag obair go ceann 14 lá tar éis an dara dáileog a fháil.

en: follow social distancing guidelines (keep two metres apart from others where possible)
ga: cloígh leis na treoirlínte maidir le scaradh sóisialta (fan dhá mhéadar amach ó dhaoine eile nuair is féidir)

en: wear a face covering
ga: cuir ort cumhdach aghaidhe

en: wash your hands regularly.
ga: nigh do lámha go rialta.
